sen.j: 高野川（たかのがわ）は、京都府京都市左京区を流れる淀川水系の一級水系である。
sen.e: The Takano-gawa River, which runs through Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is included in the first-class Yodo-gawa River water system.
The Takano-gawa River, which runs through Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is included in the first-class Yodo-gawa River water system.
The Takano-gawa River, which runs through Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is included in the first-class Yodo-gawa River system.
sen.cmt: Yodo-gawa River system としました。

sen.j: 流路延長17km。
sen.e: the length of the river is 17 km.
The length of the river is 17 km.
The length of the river is seventeen kilometers.
sen.cmt: 数字をスペルアウトしました。

tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 京都市左京区と滋賀県大津市の境に位置する途中峠の南部に発する。
sen.e: The river originates in the south of Tochu-toge Pass located at a boundary between Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City and Otsu City, Fhiga Prefecture.
The river originates in the south of Tochu-toge Pass located at a boundary between Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City and Otsu City, Fhiga Prefecture.
The river originates in the south of Tochu-toge Pass located at a boundary between Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City and Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 以降は国道367号と並行して南進する。
sen.e: Then it flows southwards along National Route 367.
Then it flows southwards along National Route 367.
Then it flows southwards along National Route 367.

sen.j: 左京区大原 (京都)北部のミタニ峠を源とする川を三谷口で合わせ、左京区鞍馬と左京区大原の境に位置する天ヶ岳を源とする高谷川を小出石町で合わせる。
sen.e: It merges, at Mitaniguchi, a river originating in Mitani-toge Pass in the northern part of Ohara (belonged to Kyoto Prefecture), Sakyo Ward, and at Kodeishi Cho, the Takatani-gawa River which originates in Tenga-dake Mountain located at a boundary between Kurama, Sakyo Ward and Ohara, Sakyo Ward

It merges, at Mitaniguchi, a river originating in Mitani-toge Pass in the northern part of Ohara (belonged to Kyoto Prefecture), Sakyo Ward, and at Kodeishi Cho, the Takatani-gawa River which originates in Tenga-dake Mountain located at a boundary between Kurama, Sakyo Ward and Ohara, Sakyo Ward

It merges, at Mitaniguchi, a river originating in Mitani-toge Pass in the northern part of Ohara (Kyoto Prefecture), Sakyo Ward, and at Kodeishi-cho, the Takatani-gawa River which originates in Mt. Tenga-dake located at a boundary between Kurama, Sakyo Ward and Ohara, Sakyo Ward.

sen.j: 三谷口からは大原川、八瀬流域では八瀬川とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: It is called the Ohara-gawa River from Mitaniguchi and also the the Yase-gawa River around the Yase area.
It is called the Ohara-gawa River from Mitaniguchi and also the the Yase-gawa River around the Yase area.
It is called the Ohara-gawa River from Mitaniguchi and also the Yase-gawa River around the Yase area.
sen.cmt: ダブりを削除しました。

sen.j: さらに三千院の裏山を源とする呂川や、寂光院の裏山を源とする草生川を合わせ、比叡山の西麓を南進する。
sen.e: After that, it flows the south foot of Hiei-zan Mountain after merging the Ryo-sen River, which originates in a mountain behind Sanzen-in Temple and also the Kusao-gawa River, which originates in a mountain behind Jakko-in Temple.

After that, it flows to the south foot of Hiei-zan Mountain after merging with the Ryo-sen River, which originates in a mountain behind Sanzen-in Temple and also the Kusao-gawa River, which originates in a mountain behind Jakko-in Temple.

After that, it flows to the south foot of Mt. Hiei after merging with the Ryo-sen River, which originates in a mountain behind Sanzen-in Temple and also the Kusao-gawa River, which originates in a mountain behind Jakko-in Temple.

sen.j: 上高野の花園橋で白川通と交差し岩倉川を合わせ、川端通と併走しながら出町柳駅の加茂大橋で鴨川 (淀川水系)と合流して鴨川 (淀川水系)となる。
sen.e: It crosses Shirakawa-dori Street at Hanazono-bashi Bridge in Kamitakano, merges the Iwakura-gawa River, flows along Shirakawa-dori Street, and is merged into the Kamo-gawa River (of the Yodo-gawa River water system) at Kamo-ohashi Bridge beside Demachiyanagi Station.

It crosses Shirakawa-dori Street at Hanazono-bashi Bridge in Kamitakano, merging with the Iwakura-gawa River, flows along Shirakawa-dori Street, and is merged into the Kamo-gawa River (of the Yodo-gawa River water system) at Kamo-ohashi Bridge beside Demachiyanagi Station.

It crosses Shirakawa-dori Street at Hanazono-bashi Bridge in Kamitakano, merging with the Iwakura-gawa River, flows along Kawabata-dori Street, and is merged into the Kamo-gawa River (Yodo-gawa River system) at Kamo-ohashi Bridge beside Demachiyanagi Station.

sen.j: 京都の地図で、鴨川はよくYの字で表されるが、その右側に当たる川である。
sen.e: In maps for Kyoto, the character Y is often used for indicating the Kamo-gawa River, where the one on the right side indicates the Takano-gawa River.
In maps for Kyoto, the character Y is often used for indicating the Kamo-gawa River, where the one on the right side indicates the Takano-gawa River.
In maps for Kyoto, the character Y is often used for indicating the Kamo-gawa River, where the one on the right side indicates the Takano-gawa River.

sen.j: オオサンショウウオ - 特別天然記念物のオオサンショウウオが棲む。
sen.e: Japanese giant salamander: Japanese giant salamanders, a special natural treasure, live there.
Japanese giant salamander: Japanese giant salamanders, a special natural treasure, live there.
Japanese giant salamander: Japanese giant salamanders, a special natural treasure, live there.

sen.j: 大雨の後などに京都市街まで流されてくることがあり、市民を驚かせる。
sen.e: When it rains heavily, it sometimes happens that some of them are flown down to the Kyoto city area, surprising people in the area.
When it rains heavily, it sometimes happens that some of them are flown down to the Kyoto city area, surprising people in the area.
When it rains heavily, it sometimes happens that some of them are flown down to the Kyoto city area, surprising people in the area.

sen.j: 地質調査の結果、平安遷都より古い時代の高野川は、（現在のように）出町柳で鴨川と合流していたわけではないという可能性が指摘されている。
sen.e: A geological investigation result points out that, before the Japanes capital was moved to Heiankyo, the Takano-gawa River might not have been mergered into the Kamo-gawa River at Demachiyanagi (as at present).

A geological investigation result points out that, before the Japanes capital was moved to Heiankyo, the Takano-gawa River might not have been mergered into the Kamo-gawa River at Demachiyanagi (as at present).

A geological investigation result points out that, before the Japanese capital was moved to Heian-kyo, the Takano-gawa River might not have been merged into the Kamo-gawa River at Demachiyanagi (as at present).
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: それによると、より南の流域で鴨川と合流していたようだ。
sen.e: According to it, it seems that the river was merged into the Kamo-gawa River in the south of the area where the two river merge now.
According to it, it seems that the river was merged into the Kamo-gawa River in the south of the area where the two river merge now.
According to it, it seems that the river was merged into the Kamo-gawa River in the south of the area where the two river merge now.

sen.j: 諸説有るが、平安時代には現在の流れであった可能性が高い。
sen.e: Although there are many opinions, it is highly likely that the river flowed in the Heian period as it does at present.
Although there are many opinions, it is highly likely that the river flowed in the Heian period as it does at present.
Although there are many opinions, it is highly likely that the river flowed in the Heian period as it does at present.

sen.j: 「日本後紀」によると、高野川は平安時代には埴川と呼ばれていた。
sen.e: According to Nihon Koki (the third of the six official national histories), the present Takano-gawa River was named the Hani-gawa River in the Heian period.
According to Nihon Koki (the third of the six official national histories), the present Takano-gawa River was named the Hani-gawa River in the Heian period.
According to Nihon Koki (the third of the six official national histories), the present Takano-gawa River was named the Hani-gawa River in the Heian period.

sen.j: 「雍州府志」によると、高野村を通ることが高野川の名前の由来だとしている。
sen.e: According to "Yoshu Fushi (a book describing various aspects of Kyoto in the Edo period)," the river was named "the Takano-gawa-River" because it flowed through Takano-mura Village.
According to "Yoshu Fushi (a book describing various aspects of Kyoto in the Edo period)," the river was named "the Takano-gawa-River" because it flowed through Takano-mura Village.
According to 'Yoshu Fushi' (a book describing various aspects of Kyoto in the Edo period), the river was named "the Takano-gawa-River" because it flowed through Takano-mura Village.

sen.j: 古くより農業用水として重用され、沿岸の村々が利益を享受していたが、渇水のたびに幾度となく村同士で対立が発生した。
sen.e: The water of the river was highly evaluated for agricultural use, benefiting villages along it, but in droughts, the villages were often confronted with each other.
The water of the river was often used for agricultural use, benefiting villages along it, but in droughts, the villages were often brought into conflict with each other.
The water of the river was often used for agricultural use, benefiting villages along it, but in droughts, the villages were often brought into conflict with each other.

sen.j: （叡山電鉄八瀬比叡山口駅以南）
sen.e: (Of the stations of Eizan Electric Railway, Yase Hieizan-guchi Station and those located in the south of the station)
(Of the stations of Eizan Electric Railway, Yase Hieizan-guchi Station and those located in the south of the station)

sen.j: 三宅小橋 - 三宅橋 - 花園橋 - 山端橋 - 松ヶ崎橋 - 馬橋 - 高野橋 - 蓼倉（たでくら）橋 - 御蔭橋 - 河合橋
sen.e: The Miyake-kobashi - the Miyake-bashi Bridge - the Hanazono-bashi Bridge - the Yamabana-bashi Bridge - the Matsugasaki-bashi Bridge - the Ma-bashi Bridge (馬橋) - the Takano-bashi Bridge - the Tadekura-bashi Bridge - the Mikage-bashi Bridge - the Kawai-bashi Brdge

sen.j: 京都府鴨川条例(2008年4月から施行)では、鴨川とともに、高野川の一部もその規制対象としている。
sen.e: The Kyoto Prefecture's Kamo-gawa River ordinance (being enforced since April of 2008) covers some part of the Takano-gawa River as well as the Kamo-gawa River.
The Kyoto Prefecture's Kamo-gawa River ordinance (being enforced since April of 2008) covers some part of the Takano-gawa River as well as the Kamo-gawa River.

sen.j: 場所によって打ち上げ花火などが規制される。
sen.e: For example, shooting-up of fireworks is prohibited in some areas of this river.
